intro: Maytenus chuchuhuasha, commonly known as the Andean mayten, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when mature and turn red upon ripening. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in mountainous areas with well-drained soil. Maytenus chuchuhuasha is also valued for its traditional medicinal uses among indigenous communities.
